Class RSAS

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.endecode.AES
      • com.endecode.RSAS

  • public class RSAS
extends AES

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RSAS(java.lang.String password)
      This is the basic constructor that just takes a password to use.
      RSAS(java.lang.String password, boolean genNewKeys)
      This is another constructor allowing the user to set the password and generate new keys.
      RSAS(java.lang.String password, java.lang.String saveLocation)
      This is the second constructor that allows the user to set a save location for where to load the keys.
      RSAS(java.lang.String password, java.lang.String saveLocation, boolean genNewKeys)
      This is the main consturctor that allows the user to set all the paramaters avalable.

      • RSAS

        public RSAS(java.lang.String password,
            java.lang.String saveLocation)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the second constructor that allows the user to set a save location for where to load the keys.
        Parameters:
        password - the password to use for encryption and decryption.
        saveLocation - the location of the keys if on other than the default is used.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • RSAS

            boolean genNewKeys)
     throws java.lang.Exception

        Parameters:
        password - the password to use for encryption and decryption
        genNewKeys - a boolean indecating weather or not to generate new keys.

      • RSAS

        public RSAS(java.lang.String password,
            java.lang.String saveLocation,
            boolean genNewKeys)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        This is the main consturctor that allows the user to set all the paramaters avalable.
        Parameters:
        password - the password used for encryption and decryption
        saveLocation - the location to save or find the keys.
        genNewKeys - boolean indecating weather or not to generate new keys to use.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • isEncrypted

        public boolean isEncrypted(byte[] data)
        Checks to see if the data given is encrypted or not. NOTE: this will also validate the signature at the same time.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
